content: if this is the first part for your project start with a foundation cord as described below and work r1 in your background color if this is not the first part of your project follow the written pattern on p 5 or chart on p 4 starting with r2 please note that if you use a different background color for this part before you work r2 you will need to work one row of back loop single_crochet stitches in your new background color color a work a foundation cord with multiples of 48 + 3 1 border st on each side and 1 st after the last repeat cut the yarn fasten_off start with the chart r1 or follow the written pattern e g 2x48+3=99 3x48+3=147 4x48+3=195 etc the multiple of 48 sts will allow you to combine all designs of mosaic christmas cal together if you want to use this pattern independently the repeat is 24+3 cut the yarn fasten_off start with chart r1 or follow the written pattern mosaic christmas cal part 10 legend the pattern repeat front loop double_crochet fldc 2 row rs below back loop single_crochet blsc single_crochet single_crochet the first st of every row r is always a standing single_crochet stsc the last st of every row r is always a normal single_crochet single_crochet if you are using my double border easy start three magic steps technique to make a double border around your project the first - border b stitch st on every row r is always a standing center single_crochet stcsc the last - border b stitch st on every row r is always a center single_crochet csc you will find more information in the file double border easy start three magic steps see the paragraph mosaic crochet basics & useful links r row r number b border stitch the first st of every row r is always a standing single_crochet stsc the last st of every row r is always a normal single_crochet single_crochet if you want to finish the project using my double border technique these border stitches have to be made differently - the first stitch st on every row r is always a standing center single_crochet stcsc the last stitch st on every row r is always a center single_crochet csc please follow the how-to in my pdf file double border easy start three magic steps c color used for this row r color a background color color b pattern color overlay mosaic crochet pattern mosaic christmas cal part 10| © bebablanket 2022 page 3 of 8 mosaic christmas cal part 10 chart overlay mosaic crochet pattern mosaic christmas cal part 10| © bebablanket 2022 page 4 of 8 mosaic christmas cal part 10 written pattern further in the written pattern single_crochet=blsc into next st except 1st and last sts on each r and r1 first st is always stsc the last one single_crochet number in front identifies how many sts you have to work r1 are all single_crochet
